results.name: Number of cyclic arrangements of S={1,2,...,n} such that the difference of any two neighbors is a divisor of their sum.
comment: a(n)=NPC(n;S;P) is the count of all neighbor-property cycles for a specific set S of n elements and a specific pair-property P. For more details, see the link and A242519.
link: S. Sykora, On Neighbor-Property Cycles, Stan's Library, Volume V, 2014.
example: The only such cycle of length n=5 is {1,2,4,5,3}.
mathematica: (* OR, a less simple, but more efficient implementation. *)
A242531[n_, perm_, remain_] := Module[{opt, lr, i, new},
If[! Divisible[Last[perm] + new, Last[perm] - new], Continue[]];
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, May 30 2014
